ball bearing mod: Originally done by Mate#1000 - This mod reduces the switch travel, making a normal length stem feel and sound like a long one - For an indepth guide to the mod check out this IMGUR album. <https://imgur.com/a/xmSVZ>
paper mod: Originally done by ChromePcok using Deskey film scrap on a Cream housing. This mod is meant to push the leaf forward to cause tactile stems have a more agressive tactile bump in linear housings. Switch#2526 converted the mod to using folded paper because he just didn't have Deskey films. Place the Deskey scrap or paper between the back of the bottom housing and the back of the leaf. Varying the amount of paper/layers will increase and decrease the amount of tactility. Video by Switch#2526 on performing the modification <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQqLvu7RMiE>
crimping pins:
Crimping pins is a neccesary thing when using a top that doens't support the switch leaf. The most famous occasion of this happening is cherry tops on jwk, or cream tops on gateron/jwk.

Here is a guide originally shared by Awalkerstop
<https://imgur.com/a/v9EQrdC>
tempest mod:
Originally created by oTEMPESTo#6100 this mod makes switches or smth quieter, idk man watch the video

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4T8Ov74i4m0>
epsi mod:
EpsiMod
a variation of the holee mod using deskeys film extra material and double sided tape

<https://youtu.be/aDX-jwbqie4>
